column4: Hm.  Okay, I just moved the taskbar (or whatever it's called) to the right side of the screen and expanded it some, but it's caused the show-desktop icon to become ridiculously gigantic.  How can I return it to a reasonable size yet have my taskbar be wide enough to read the labels?
GNOME doesn't do vertical panels very well at all.  It may not be doable.  Suggested workaround:  Set a show-desktop keyboard shortcut and use that.
All right.  How do I do that?
